record.title: 880-03 Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām : manuscript / Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī.
record.note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Ḥamdan li-man faqqaha fī al-dīn man irtaḍāhu min ʻibādih, fa-salakū minhāj al-rashād ʻalá wafq murādih, wa-ṣalātan wa-salāman ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn, al-qāʼil 'Man yarid Allāh bi-hi khayran yufaqqihhu fī al-dīn', wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-al-tābiʻīn wa-tābiʻīhim bi-iḥsān ilá Yawm al-Dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi wa-iḥsānah, wa-muʼammil min Allāh faḍla jūdihi wa-imtinānah, Ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Maḥallī al-Shāfiʻī: Lammā kathura al-suʼāl ʻan waqāʼiʻ al-aḥwāl, wa-zāda al-ishtighāl fī al-ḥall wa-al-irtiḥāl, wa-qalla man yujību al-sāʼil bi-al-manqūl, wa-iʻtamad al-muftīyūn [al-muftūn] ʻalá jawāhir al-ʻuqūl, wa-rubbamā ajābū fī al-wāqiʻāt bi-ghayr mā qarrarahu al-aʼimmah min al-manqūlāt, aradtu an ajmaʻa mā yartāḥu bi-hi al-labīb wa-yakshufu al-karb ʻan kull muhimm gharīb ..."
Secundo folio: al-sukhūnah wa-al-burūdah wa-māʼ diyār Thamūd.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.2 cm; 23 lines per page.

In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; titles of the legal issues on the margins, preceded by the word "maṭlab" (question, issue, matter), catchwords.
At the head of folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."
On folio 1a: "Kitāb Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām, taʼlīf al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn."
On folio 1a: Quotations from the poetry of the author and his son Aḥmad.
On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu Kashf al-lithām ʻan asʼilat al-anām ..."

Author's colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā jamʻahu, jaʻalahu Allāh khāliṣan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-mukhalliṣan min hawl al-karb al-ʻaẓīm, wa-fataḥa ʻalá man talaqqāhu bi-qalb salīm."

Translation of the author's colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. This is the end of what we wanted to compile. May God render it purely for the sake of His gracious face, and a means for deliverance from the torment of the horrible distress [Judgment Day]. May He reward him who wholeheartedly accepts it."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-hādhihi al-nuskhah nuqilat min musawwadat muʼllifihā al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallāwī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi wa-al-muslimīn. Thumma inna al-muʼallif bayyaḍa wa-jamaʻa nuskhatahu fī 15 shahr Shawwāl, sanat 1155. <Āmīn>. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Arbaʻ al-mubārak, 14 shahr Rajab al-ḥarām, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah khamsah wa-thamānīn <1175>. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb. In tajid ʻayban fa-sudda al-khalalā // jalla man lā fīhi ʻaybun wa-ʻalā."

Translation of the copyist's colophon: "This copy was transcribed from the draft of its author al-Shaykh Ḥusayn al-Maḥallāwī, may God benefit [us] and the Muslims by his sciences. The author then wrote and compiled a fair copy, on 15 Shawwāl, 1155 [13 December, 1742]. <Amen>. This copy was completed on blessed Wednesday, 14 Rajab, 1185 [23 October, 1771]. <1175>. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct. If you were to find a blemish close the gap // Mighty and Sublime is the One in whom no blemish exists."

record.title: 880-02 Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum : manuscript / Burhān al-Dīn al-Zarnūjī.
record.note: Title of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum" from incipit (folio 9b).

Incipit of the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": "Aʻūdhu billāh min al-Shayṭān al-rajīm. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Majlis al-ḥādī wa-al-thalāthūn: Fī bayān ṣadaqat al-fiṭr wa-aḥkām al-ʻīdayn wa-bayān al-bidaʻ fīhi [fīhimā]. Faraḍ Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam, zakāt al-Fiṭr ṭuhratan lil-ṣiyām min al-lahw wa-al-laghw wa-al-rifth wa-ṭuʻmatan lil-masākīn. Wa-hādhā al-Ḥadīth min ḥisān al-Maṣābīḥ, rawāhu Ibn ʻAbbās, wa-huwa yadullu ʻalá wujūb ṣadaqat al-Fiṭr, li-anna al-farḍ fī al-lughah bi-maʻná al-taqdīr, wa-fī al-sharʻ bi-maʻná al-ījāb. Wa-lafẓ al-Shāriʻ dāra bayna al-maʻná al-sharʻī wa-maʻná [wa-al-maʻná] al-lughawī, yataʻayyanu ḥamluhu ʻalá al-maʻná al-sharʻī mā amkana, li-anna al-ghālib min ḥāl al-Nabī, ʻalayhi al-salām, taʻrīf al-aḥkām dūn al-lughāt, fa-ʻalá hādhā yakūnu al-maʻná anna wujūb ṣadaqat al-Fiṭr ʻalá al-insān li-fāʼidatan ..."
Secundo folio of the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": bi-al-mubāsharah wa-baʻḍuhum bi-al-mushāhadah.

Incipit of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī faḍḍala banī Ādam bi-al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻamal ʻalá jamīʻ al-ʻālam, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Muḥammad Sayyid al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih yanābīʻ al-ʻulūm wa-al-ḥikam. Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā raʼaytu kathīran min ṭullāb al-ʻilm fī zamāninā yajiddūna ilá al-ʻilm wa-lā yaṣilūn, wa-min manāfiʻihi wa-thamarātihi, wa-hiya al-ʻamal bi-hi wa-al-nashr yuḥramūn, limā annahum akhṭaʼū ṭarāʼiqahu wa-tarakū sharāʼiṭ [sharāʼiṭahu] <annī>, wa-kull man akhṭaʼa al-ṭarīq ḍalla, wa-lā yanālu al-maqṣūd qalla aw jalla, aradtu wa-aḥbabtu an ubayyina lahum ṭarīq al-taʻallum ʻalá mā raʼaytu fī al-Kitāb wa-samiʻtu min asātīdhī ulī al-ʻilm wa-al-ḥikam rajāʼ al-duʻāʼ lī min al-rāghibīn fīhi al-mukhliṣīn bi-al-fawz wa-al-khalāṣ fī Yawm al-Dīn mā istakhartu lillāh taʻālá fīhi, wa-sammaytuhu 'Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum', wa-jaʻaltuhu fuṣūlan ..."
Secundo folio of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": fī taʻẓīm al-ʻilm wa-ahlih.
15 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 15 lines per page. Written surface for the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": 13.5 x 19 cm; 17-19 lines per page.

"Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum" is written in good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords. The excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār" is written in fair naskh/ruqʻah script.
On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Waqf lillāh taʻālá."
At the head of folio 2b: An endowment statement: "Waqf al-marḥūm ʻAbbās Bāshā."
Folios 3b-9a are blank; text of "Taʻlī al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum" (folios 9b-30a).
On folio 9b: "Munājāt [Munājāh]. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Lā ilāha illā Allāh, Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh. Hādhā kitāb Taʻlīm mutaʻallim."

Colophon of the excerpt from "Majālis al-abrār wa-masālik al-akhyār": No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... Naʻam. Inna hādhihi al-ayyām ayām faraḥ wa-surūr, lākin yanbaghī an yakūna iẓhār al-faraḥ wa-al-surūr fīhā bi-mā kāna mubāḥan aw mustaḥabban, ka-al-ightisāl wa-al-taṭayyub wa-lays [wa-libs] aḥsan al-sayyiʼāt [al-thiyāb?] al-mubāḥah allatī takūn jadīdah aw ghasīlah ʻalá mā sayajīʼ, lā bi-mā kāna ḥarām [ḥarāman], ka-libs al-ḥarīr wa-al-khawḍ fī al-bāṭil, li-anna al-ʻīd innamā summiya ʻīdan li-annahu taʻālá yaʻūdu fīhi ʻalá al-muʼmin bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-iḥsān, fa-yajibu ʻalayhim an yajtanibū al-maʻṣiyah wa-al-ṭughyān ḥattá yakūnū min ahl al-saʻādah wa-al-ruḍwān, lā min ahl al-shaqāwah wa-al-khidhlān. Wa-qad ḥukiya ʻan baʻḍ al-ʻārifīn annahu [marra] yawm al-ʻīd bi-qawm yalʻabūn wa-yaḍḥakūn, fa-qāl: In kāna tuqubilla min hāʼulāʼ lazimahum an yashkurū wa-laysa hādhā fiʻl al-shākirīn, wa-in kāna lam tuqubilla [yutaqabbal] minhum lazimahum an yakhāfū wa-laysa hādhā fiʻl al-khāʼifīn. Thumma yanbaghī an yuʻlam anna baʻḍ al-nās qad zaʻamū anna ..."

Colophon of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh awwalan wa-ākhiran. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khayr al-anām, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. 18 Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1191."

Translation of the colophon of "Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim ṭarīq al-taʻallum": "Praise be to God at the beginning and at the end. Praise be to God for the completion. May prayer be upon our Master Muḥammad, the best of mankind, and upon his family and all his companions. 18 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 1191 [of the Hijrah = 17 January, 1778]."

record.title: J. L. Manning letter, Prophetstown, Illinois, to H. Keeling, Amboy, Illinois, 1865 June 13 : manuscript.
California merchant ledger : manuscript.
record.note: Note on cover: "Appendage to the ledger".

record.title: Parish reports : manuscript.
record.note: 3 reports bound separately and laid in an earlier recycled binding, circa 1740.

record.title: Santa Fe Pacific Railroad Company audit book : manuscript.
record.note: Embossed on spine: “Bills No. 1 / From June 1st 1904 to / S.F.P.R.R. Co. / Audit Office”.

record.title: “Joe” letter, Dawson City, Yukon, to “Dear Mother sister and kids”, 1898 March 12 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by Michael D. Heaston.

record.title: Paul Van Thorniley diary : typescript.
record.note: Typescript note accompanying journal: “Original manuscript of a diary kept by Paul Van Thorniley (my great uncle) covering his trip from Seattle to Dawson in 1898 in search of gold”.

record.title: James Judd letter, Farmington, Utah, to Henry W. Nichols, Vandergrift, Pennsylvania, 1912 February 16 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a partial manuscript transcription made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Catalogue of the prints of Jacques Callot : manuscript.
record.note: Bound in late 19th- early 20th-century red morocco, all edges gilt; paper watermarked 1794.

record.title: Scrapbook concerning Glacier National Park and Yellowstone National Park : manuscript.
Peter Jones declaration of faith : manuscript.
record.note: Likely removed from a volume. The recto, with Jones's declaration of faith, is numbered 205. On the verso, numbered 206, are two religious compositions by John Bird. One is untitled and dated 1834, and the other is a religious poem entitled To the Moon and dated 1837.

record.title: Fragment containing medical recipes.
record.note: No content on verso of either leaf. Used as binding waste.

record.title: Carbon Hill Coal Company ledger : manuscript.
record.note: Water damage and stains on first 30 leaves of ledger.

record.title: Des Moines city planning notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Stamped on first page: This book is property of City of Des Moines Engineering Department.

record.title: James L. Bowers declaration concerning slavery in Maryland : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by later printouts of related newspaper clippings from 1858.

record.title: Japanese national defense review following American and Russian naval expeditions : manuscript.
record.note: Volume in original wrappers, with later stitching.

record.title: Petaluma, California tax ledger : manuscript.
record.note: From front cover: Petaluma Township No. 1
Several loose sheets have been laid in throughout the volume.

record.title: Records of vestry minutes and accounts : manuscript.
Records of Odd Fellows Woolwich No. 4 Lodge : manuscript.
record.note: Bound in original vellum, ruled in blind and fainty incribed in ink ‘ODD FELLOWS’.

record.title: [Collection of broadsides issued by the Tottenham Park Association].
record.note: Broadsides printed by Harold and Emberlin, Marlborough, England.

record.title: John Tregerthen Short diary : manuscript.
record.note: Neat manuscript in brown ink on lined paper; bound in twentieth-century quarter calf with nonpareil marbled boards, spine gilt in compartments, red morocco lettering piece in one.

record.title: M. W. Holley letter, Fort Yamhill, Oregon, to "Dear Hazen", 1857 May 31 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: James Cooper McKee letter, New York, New York, to George Hannah, 1881 January 11 : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: James Cooper McKee, Narrative of the surrender of a command of U.S. forces at Fort Fillmore, N.M., in July, 1861, at the breaking out of the civil war (New York, 1881) (call number Zc54 878mab).

record.title: Thomas Nuttall letter, Fort George, to John Kirk Townsend, Fort Vancouver, 1835 October 11 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: William H. Powell letter, Fort Morgan, Colorado, to Christopher Columbus Augur, Omaha, Nebraska, 1867 August 11 : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: William H. Powell, A history of the organization and movements of the 4th regiment of Infantry, U.S.A., 1796-1870 (Washington City, M'Gill & Witherow, 1871) (call number Zc10 871po).

record.title: William Jenkins Worth letter, Puebla, Mexico, to "My dear General", 1847 May 30 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Lillias and Sophia Stuart music album : manuscript.
record.note: With an etched title-page with decorative border, lettered ‘Sold by Rt. Birchall, No 133, New Bond Street’ at foot. Birchall was a publisher and music and musical instrument seller who traded from 133 New Bond Street from 1789 to 1819.
Pages are ruled with staves; a small musical addition is pinned to the foot of one page.
Bound in original(?) tree sheep, rebacked.

record.title: P. H. Perkins letter, Todd's Valley, California, to "Brother Cobb", 1859 May 29 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Payment order for ranch surveys : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: A Sketch of the life of Peter Donahue, of San Francisco, 1822-1885 (San Francisco: Crocker & Company, 1888) (call number Zc72 +888sk).

record.title: T. L. Price letter, Saint Louis, Missouri, to John S. Phelps, 1853 April 30 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Reverend Stopford album of invoices and receipts, mathematical workbook : printed text and manuscript.
Land deed to Edward Otho Cresap Ord : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Franklin Pierce letter, Concord, New Hampshire, to James K. Polk, 1847 February 1 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Robert T. Barry journals : manuscript.
record.note: Bindings: half calf over marbled boards. With bookseller's ticket to the front pastedown of each volume: Rua do Ouvidor no. 36. O livro encarnado loja de papel ... de J. C. Bouvier. Rio de Janeiro.

record.title: New Bedford Anti Slavery Society minute book : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: contemporary half-calf over marbled paper boards.

record.title: Julia Nichols Tyesi letter, Middledrift, Cape Province, South Africa, to Helen Burrell, Asbury Park, New Jersey, 1934 August 15 : manuscript.
Maurice Baring commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Date from presentation inscription on the verso of the front free endpaper: Diana's Monday present from Maurice Baring November 19, Monday 1928.
Accompanied by dealer description showing provenance from John Julius Norwich, Diana Cooper's son.

record.title: Letter to Mr. Jess : typescript.
record.note: Place and date of production from evidence in photographs affixed to page [1].

record.title: Bradford E. Williams scrapbook : manuscript.
record.note: Material removed from a pocket leaf ring binder and rehoused in archival folders after acquisition.

record.title: Mary, Queen of Scots letter to Gilbert Kennedy, Earl of Cassilis.
Henry VIII, King of England letter signed, to Sir Richard Long and Michael Stanhope.
record.note: Signed: "Henry R." at the head of the text, preceded by the words "By the king." Remains of signet seal.

record.title: [Haloid Company photographic papers sample book].
record.note: Place of creation and date supplied by cataloger.

record.title: French royal household accounts from reign of Louis XIII : manuscript.
John T. Harcourt petition for the Jesse Green, Jr. estate's sale of Dew and Rachael : manuscript.
record.note: Docket title from verso: "Petition for sale of negroes" .

record.title: W. Burt scrapbook : manuscript.
record.note: The compiler is unidentified. Content associated with the Burt family includes the leather label on the front cover, a watercolor drawing of Cannington Church signed by "Lieut. T.S. Burt" and annotated "Rev. Charles H. Burt," and newspaper clipping of a wedding announcement for Major Thomas Seymour Burt, F.R.S., and Elizabeth, widow of Thomas Seaton Forman, Esq., of Pippbrook House, Surrey.

record.title: Olivia Wilmot Serres poems : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note tipped in: "The red book which you will find was once the lamented Princess Charlotte Coburgh's book."
Bound in red morocco with gilt tooling.

record.title: James Pemberton correspondence : manuscript copy.
[Photographs relating to Jean-Michel Basquiat and Kelle Jean Inman].
record.note: Place and date of creation supplied by cataloger.

record.title: [Photographs of Van Masters van club].
record.note: Place of creation supplied by cataloger.

record.title: [Photograph album of a soldier’s tour of duty of Burma, China, and India].
record.note: Place of creation supplied by cataloger.

record.title: Notes and formulas for the preparation of paints, varnishes, oils, etc. : manuscript.
record.note: The date of production is estimated from the watermark on one of the accompanying notes.

record.title: Diary describing travels in Italy and Switzerland : manuscript.
record.note: Date is extrapolated based on the stationary from the Grand Hotel Locarno that is dated "190_" with the end digit left blank to be filled in. Of the years from 1900 to 1909, the dates and days of the week in the diary align with the year 1906.

Three different types of stationary are included. Four sheets are from the Grand Hotel Locarno with an engraved headpiece of the hotel and surrounding landscape. Two sheets are from Hotel Bear in Grindelwald bearing a wood engraving illustration of the hotel and nearby glacier accompanied by two other decorative illustrated scenes. Two sheets are from the Grand Hotel Thunerhof with an engraved headpiece of the hotel alongside Hotel Bellevue.

record.title: Draft announcement on the employment of boys from the Blue Coat Hospital in Manchester : manuscript.
record.note: Writing is only on one side of the sheet.
Last two digits of the date are unclear.

record.title: Letter from Edward Fullbrook to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: "In the matter of a petition filed on behalf Edward Fullbrook, formerly of Summer-town, St Giles', Oxford, and late of Woodcott, Southstoke, Oxford, Yeoman, being a person of unsound mind, and a prisoner in the gaol of Oxford Castle, in the County of Oxford. Whereas it appears to the court, by the record of William Henry Ashhurst, esq. one of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the said county, made and certified to the court by the said Justice of the Peace, according to the statue in that behalf, that the said prisoner is of unsound mind, and therefore incapable of taking the benefit of the said act in such manner as a person of sound mind might do ... it is ordered and appointed, that application shall be made to the court for the discharge of the said prisoner, at the court-house, in Portugal Street, Lincoln's-Inn-Fields, on the 25th day of November 1839, at the hour of ten in the forenoon precisely, in order that the court may proceed to the discharge of said prisoner, if otherwise entitled thereto according to the true intent and meaning of the said act."--London Gazette, 1839 November 1.

record.title: Letter from James I to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: On the folded sheet, there is writing on only the recto of the first page. The other pages are blank.
Autograph letter signed by James I.

record.title: Letter from Albert, Prince Consort, to Prince Victor of Hohenlohe-Langenburg : manuscript.
record.note: There is writing on only one side of the folded leaf.
Date of production is derived from the date of Prince Ernst's death.

record.title: Letter from Albert, Prince Consort, to an unidentified recipient : manuscript.
record.note: There is writing on only two pages of the folded sheet. The recto pages are decorated with a gold crown stamp in the top left corner.

The Mr. Meyer referenced in the letter may likely be William Meyer, Stallmeister and Master of the Horse, who was a part of the royal household. He retired from royal service in 1871. The Lord Albemarl referenced in the letter may likely be William Keppel, 4th Earl of Albemarle, who was the Master of Horse, under Lord Melbourne.

record.title: Music and songs : manuscript.
record.note: Engraved title page: "Vaudeville. Menuets, contradances, et air detachées. Chanté sur les théâtres des comedies française et italienne ... A Paris Chez Madame Boivin ...".

record.title: The History of little Jack : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page: "(The Little Jack) Il Piccolo Nanni Storia del Sig: Tommaso Day Volgarizzata da Tomasso Parker".
Binding: contemporary half sheep and marbled paper boards.

record.title: Recipe book : manuscript.
record.note: From title page: "Extrait simple, et aisé de diverse façons de travailler tant en gras, qu'en maigre du cuisinier moderne".
Binding: contemporary speckled paper over boards.

record.title: Pierre Denis Dardenne medical recipe book : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page: "Traité d'ostéologie contenant la maladie des os et les accidents qui leur arriuent. Tiré de la chirurgie complette de Mr. Dionis Docteur en Medecine. Avec un traité des simples les plus en usage. Le tout ecrit par moy Pierre Denis Dardenne etudiant en chirurgie".

record.title: Margaret Emma Caldwell diaries : manuscript.
record.note: Volume 1, spanning the period 21 September 1812 - 24 December 1814, is written in brown ink in a single hand on paper watermarked 1810; bound in contemporary quarter reversed calf over marbled boards.

Volume 2, spanning the period 7 February 1819 - 30 September 1820, is written in brown ink in a single hand on paper watermarked 1816; bound in contemporary marbled wrappers, with remains of red wax seal to upper cover.

record.title: Hannah More letter, Barley Wood, to Dr. Percival, October 14 : manuscript.
record.note: Date based on Hannah More's period of residence at Barley Wood; she built the house on the estate in 1801, and she moved from there to Bristol in 1828.
Single sheet, with address on verso.
Recipient of the letter is possibly Thomas Percival (1740-1804).

record.title: Diary in Turkey and Greece : manuscript.
record.note: With ink stamp: "Exbibl. Princ. Const. Karadja."

record.title: Richard Merrick letter, Jericho, St. Thos. in the Vale, to John Harfield Tredgold, London, 1840 January 10 : manuscript.
record.note: Verso of second leaf with address panel and postal markings.

record.title: Thomas Sutton commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: The first page is dated "November 5th 1819". Only the first approximately 120 leaves are used; all entries dated 1819-1824 apart from several leaves dated 1826. The watercolor drawing is on paper watermarked "Newton 1816".
Original printed paper-covered boards (lacks spine covering), hand-ruled ink outer border. With Thomas Sutton's ownership label pasted on inside front cover.

record.title: John Le Capelain letter to J.J. Gabousel : manuscript.
record.note: Address and date, "15 New King Street May 2o 1841," are written at the head of the letter. Each page of the letter is numbered in the top corner. The letter also features traces of the original wax seal near the written address to "J.J. Gabourel [illegible] of Colomberie, St Heliers, Jersey."

record.title: Remarks on the Battle of Buena Vista by Brevet Major Carleton : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: James Henry Carleton, The Battle of Buena Vista (New York: Harper and Brothers, 1848) (copy discarded).

record.title: Bakumatsu era reports and letters : manuscript.
record.note: On double leaves, traditional East Asian binding style (fukurotoji).

record.title: Manuscript book of verses : manuscript.
record.note: Ink monogram stamp "EC" on inside front cover, possibly that of Rev. Edward Cooper (1727-1792).

record.title: Album relating to Richard Parkes Bonington : manuscript.
record.note: A reproduction of a painting, "The Coast of Picardy," by Bonington from the Wallace Collection is inserted in the volume behind the front flyleaf.

record.title: Lacovia Plantation account book : manuscript.
record.note: Signed on final page: "Errors excepted the 26th April 1746 Rose Fuller attorney to John Hodges Esq.".
Binding: paper wrappers, the front cover printed with an engraving captioned "Capt. George Lowther and his company at Port Mayo in the Gulph of Matique".

record.title: Sir Everard Home letter books containing letters to Sir James Everard Home : manuscript.
record.note: Signed by William Clift on the final page of volume two: "W.C. 1820".
Engraved booksellers' ticket on the front pastedown of volume two: "Made & sold by Rowe & Waller. Stationers, late Marsh & Dunsford, 49, Fleet Street, London.".
Binding: matching set in full leather with blind and gilt tooled panels and gilt tooled spines.
Box 1: volume one. Box 2: volume two.

record.title: Mary Linwood letter, to an unidentified recipient, July 27, about trilobite and fossil specimens she has obtained : manuscript.
record.note: The address "No. 75 Oxford Terrace, Hyde Park. 27th July" is written at the head of the letter.

record.title: Sir Henry Holland papers, 1805-1868 (bulk 1805-1843).
record.note: Box 1 contains six volumes: "Essays on Various Subjects" including "On the Doctrine of Necessity" and "On the Nature & Origin of Human Passions & Affections," with a translation from Sophocles laid in, 1805-1806; "Journal in Spain," 1812; "Journal in Lombardy, Austria, Prussia, &c.," 1815; "Sketches in Italy & Germany, Belgium, &c." [includes Hungary and Holland], 1815; "Journal in the North of Italy and France," 1816; and "Journey to Spa" [Belgium and France], 1818. Box 2 contains two volumes: "No. I," 1812; and "Vol. II," 1830-1843.
Boxes 3-6 contain two copies each of Holland's General View of the Agriculture of Cheshire (1813), and Recollections of Past Life (1868). All were cataloged separately.

record.title: Admission ticket for the Mary Linwood exhibition at Hanover Sqr. Concert Rooms, 1802 : manuscript.
record.note: The ticket is accompanied by a newspaper clipping with a printed portrait of "the Late Miss Linwood," and the caption text "Miss Linwood, of the Exhibition of Needlework, in Leicester-square, died in March, 1845. She was then in her ninetieth year." The admission ticket and the portrait are mounted together on a larger sheet of blue paper.

record.title: Albert Henry Warren scrapbook.
Robert Bruce letter concerning the wax sculpture of his mother, Rose Bruce : manuscript.
record.note: The sculpture described in the present letter is now in the collections of the Yale Center for British Art. See link herewith.

record.title: Westfield School Society records of the Westfield School District : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript title: “Records of the West Ville. West School. District from 1835 April 14th.”

record.title: Dialing notebook : manuscript.
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania municipal charter : manuscript copy.
record.note: Manuscript note at end: “A true Copy taken from the original.”

record.title: William MacMurdo Duncan scrapbook : printed text and manuscript.
record.note: Approximately 40 pages with clippings and broadsheets, and an equivalent number of blanks; dates of the printed matter range from the 1790s to approximately 1815. Among the loosely inserted items is a manuscript poem dated 14 March 1816.

record.title: Ojibwa dictionary : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript title on first page: “Indian Dictionary.”
C. Nohounskawa is penciled onto the cover.

record.title: The Lord’s prayer : manuscript copy.
record.note: Manuscript note accompanying text: “found in old copy of [Joseph Nicoll] Scott’s English Dictionary of 1764.”

record.title: Daniel Boardman sermon : manuscript.
record.note: Sermon is in a wrapper with a manuscript note by Donald Lines Jacobus detailing its provenance.

record.title: David Ely sermon : manuscript.
James Lockwood sermon : manuscript.
Henry A. Lovell account book : manuscript.
record.note: Stamp on first page: "Henry A. Lovell / Dealer In Dry Goods, Groceries, Etc., / Alstead, N.H."

record.title: Thomas Bradbury Chandler sermon : manuscript.
record.note: Sermon is noted as having been preached on 1752 January 5, 1752 December 17, and 1754 September 26.

record.title: Samuel Checkley sermon : manuscript.
record.note: Sermon is noted as being preached 1741 May 24, 1742 September 26, and 1742 October 17.

record.title: James Eckersall account book for 1731 and 1732 : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript booklabel on verso of front flyleaf: "James Eckersall Clerk of the Kitchin to His Majesty at St. Iames's."
Presentation inscription on verso of front flyleaf: "Clara Wynne from Clara M Eckersall May 1870."

Binding: late 17th-century full red morocco; multipanel, heavily gold-tooled and stamped; central lozenge contaning double-headed thistle. Two metal bosses on front cover. Marbled end papers. Remnants of pocket.

record.title: Ephraim Griswold Swift sermon : manuscript.
record.note: Sermon is noted as having been preached 1842 August 7 and 1845 December 14.

record.title: Roger Sherman account book : manuscript.
record.note: The first 40 pages of the volume have been torn out--only portions remain.

record.title: José de Gálvez letter to Antonio Maria Bucareli y Ursùa, 1776 August 12 : manuscript.
record.note: Docket title: "...Virrey de Nueva España...debe costease el Juicio de la Inquisición de Mexico la conducción de los Reos sentenciados...".

record.title: Justus Forward sermon : manuscript.
James Wallace Bentley diary : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typescript transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: Nehemiah Walter sermons : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note on back cover: “This manuscript belongs to Rev. Wills.”

record.title: Samuel John Mills sermon : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note on front cover: “This was given me by the father of the Rev S. J. Mills whose life [illegible].”
Accompanied by a manuscript note detailing the item’s provenance.

record.title: Architecture notebook relating to the papal conclave of 1689 : manuscript.
record.note: Spine title: Study d'archit[ettura] d[i] santif[icato] conclav[e] di Cav[aliere] Fon[tana].
Binding: Contemporary vellum over boards; raised bands and gilt lettering piece on spine. Inscribed in manuscript at foot of spine: "MSS 90".
Monogram ink stamp on front flyleaf recto: "UB RMS". Ink stamp on verso of last leaf: "51310".

record.title: Jonathan Edwards agreement with the town of Bolton, Connecticut : photostatic copy.
record.note: Catalog card notes item as being a “Photostatic reproduction of Bolton town records, 1723, vol.1, p.8-9.”

record.title: Hartford and New-Haven Turnpike Company account of expenditures : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: United States. Dept. of the Treasury, An account of the receipts and expenditures of the United States for the year 1803 (Washington City : [s.n., 1804?]) (call number BEIN NNj10 A5 1803).

record.title: Pilot guide for the Spanish frigate Juno : manuscript.
record.note: First leaf inscribed: Libro derrotero para el uso de D[o]n BRTE[?] BGCTES[?] alférez de fragata de la R[ea]l Arm[a]da se acabó de escrivir oy dia 13 del mes de Junio, abordo de la fragata de S. M. nombrada Sn. Francisco Xavier, (alias) la Juno, viniendo de buelta de su viage de Manila para el Puerto de Cadiz el Año de 1780.

record.title: Document recommending Leverett A. Hemingway for post of prison inspector : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: Daniel Walter Strickland, Connecticut fights; the story of the 102nd regiment (New Haven: Quinnipiack Press, c1930) (call number: BI73m +930s).

record.title: Benjamin Tallmadge letter, Wethersfield, Connecticut, to Nathan Hale, New London, Connecticut, 1774 July 4 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber.

record.title: [Photograph of musician figurines in front of jazz albums].
record.note: Date of creation supplied by cataloger.

record.title: George Berkeley letter, Rhode Island, to Henry Newman, Holborn, London, 1730 March 29 : manuscript.
record.note: Accompanied by a typed transcript made by an unidentified transcriber, a negative photostatic copy of the letter, and a typescript providing some context for the letter.

record.title: Religious miscellany : manuscript.
record.note: Decoration: 4 fold-out and 63 full-page miniatures. Rubrication.
Binding: Contemporary blind-tooled calf, clasps broken.
Manuscripts annotations in multiple hands on front and rear pastedowns and flyleaves. Unidentified shelfmark: по списку, n. 15 (po spisku). Stamp: Printed in Soviet Union.

record.title: Ezekiel Cheever notes of a Boston, Massachusetts prayer meeting : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note on inside front cover: “Contains autographs of Schoolmaster Ezekiel Cheever and his son Thomas, and others. The constitution is in the old schoolmaster’s chirography. HMD.”

record.title: Volume of two tracts of John Eliot : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note opposite title page: “The two tracts, in these pages following continued, I have copied with the greatest care, with my own hand, from the originals (supposed to be unique) which were in my possession [...] Henry M. Dexter. Hillside, Roxbury. 21 April, 1864.”

record.title: Thomas Cartwright letters against Brownism : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note opposite first title page: “Copied for me, in the spring of 1871; by A. A. Burt.”
Manuscript note opposite second title page: “The answer unto a letter of Master Harrisons, which follows, I have copied from a book in Dr. Williams’s Library [...] London, 19 May, 1871. H.M.D.”

record.title: Henry Martyn Dexter abstract of Robert Harrison’s A little treatise vppon the firste verse of the 122. Psalm : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript note opposite title page: “This is a little book of Robert Harrison’s [...] I have made this abstract from the copy in the British Museum [3090.a.] having given in full the title page and preface, and the pith of what bears upon the Church Government Controversy. 15 Nov. 1871. HMD.”

record.title: Eleazer Wheelock letter to Joseph Bellamy, Bethlehem, Connecticut, 1742 April 11 : manuscript.
James Davenport letter "to the Revd. moderator of ye Association of ye County of Lichfield" : manuscript.
Francis White letter to “Mr. Young” : manuscript.
record.note: Removed from: Francis White, The Philadelphia directory (Philadelphia : Printed by Young, Stewart, and M'Culloch, in Chesnut-Street, M,DCC,LXXXV. [1785]) (call number 2004 1386).

record.title: Dialing notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Bound with John Edwards, Directions for Making the Best Composition of Casting, Grinding and Polishing, and Giving Them the True Parabolic Figure, London, [1783?], and another autograph notebook on astronomical instruments. Number 3 of 3 titles bound together. Volume extent: 356 pages.

record.title: Notebook of astronomical instruments : manuscript.
record.note: Bound with John Edwards, Directions for Making the Best Composition of Casting, Grinding and Polishing, and Giving Them the True Parabolic Figure, London, [1783?], and an autograph notebook on dailing. Number 2 of 3 titles bound together. Volume extent: 356 pages.

record.title: Hans Smit advertisements of medicines : typescript.
record.note: Accompanying typescript note: "One of two copies used as end papers in a copy in contemporary binding of "Sermons of Master John Calvin upon the book of Job" translated out of the French by Arthur Golding. / Colophon: Imprinted at London. Henrie Binneman for Lucas Harrison & George Bishop. Anno. 1574. / These broadsides were noticed in August 1919 and taken out."

record.title: Program for 1914 concert featuring the music and songs of Black composers, performed at Ebenezer Methodist Episcopal Church, Jacksonville, Florida : typescript / printed by Chas. J. Lightsy, 615 W. Duval St.
record.note: Title on the front cover is "Programme : A Chorus of Thirty Voices presents Negro Music as written by the foremost Negro composers under auspices of Ladies' Auxiliary of Provident Hospital at Ebenezer Methodist Episcopal Church."

record.title: Livres de Pierre Lecuire: Exposition à la Bibliothèque Nationale de France : videorecording / Architecte de l'exposition Frédéric Beauclair Réalisation: Jean-Louis Laforêt Assisté de: Jean-François Bauret Arthur Cemin Musique: Erich Wolfgang Korngold.
record.note: The date of the item was estimated based on information from the label and the date of acquisition.
Autograph note on paper adhered to back of case: Gift to the Beinecke Library from Pierre Lecuire. 14.02.2003 2/5.

record.title: Press release containing Willa Robertson's prize-winning essay My experiences with integration : typescript.
record.note: Date estimated from textual clues and Tougaloo Southern Christian College's 1962 name change to Tougaloo College.
On United Negro College Fund letterhead.

record.title: Notes on religion, care of the body, monarchy, and other subjects : manuscript.
record.note: To view associated print record, search by call number: Obsorn fpb93.

record.title: Verena Roy notebook : manuscript.
Program for Dark cavalcade : a drama with music, presented by the Negro Little Theatre of Norwalk : typescript.
record.note: Originally stapled together as a single volume; staples removed due to preservation concerns.

record.title: A list and short description of the birds of the United States according to Alexander Wilson's American ornithology : manuscript.
record.note: Date estimated from information printed on original slipcase.

record.title: Richard Polwhele notebooks : manuscript.
record.note: The first ten volumes have been roughly stitched together (much of the sewing now broken), many with their original marble wrappers. The second also sewn together and numbered I-VII.

record.title: Journal and commonplace book of a young lady, 30 September 1794 : manuscript and printed text.
record.note: Pagination: 86; 35, [33, blanks], [12, pages containing pasted-in newspaper scraps, engravings].
Bound in contemporary full calf, red morocco label to front board stamped in gold "Journal" and with a paper label with a title in manuscript "Young lady's journal of 1794" in later hand. Rebacked.

record.title: Diary : manuscript.
record.note: Includes a transcript of the diary provided by the bookseller.

record.title: Copy of letter to Rufus Ingalls and table of distances from Walla Walla to Salt Lake City, 1858 : manuscript.
record.note: Date of copy based on contextual information provided by the items in WA MSS S-4021 In4.

record.title: George Foljambe pocket book recording expenditure in London : manuscript.
record.note: Numbering: 27 unnumbered pages, tabbed index, 90, 2 unnumbered pages.
In contemporary plain vellum wallet binding; faded contemporary ink titling to back cover: George Foljambe ... 1733 ... 1734.

record.title: John Seton notebook of private expenses : manuscript.
record.note: Manuscript in ink; octavo; 18 numbered pages interleaved with blanks, with seven blank leaves at the end; stitched as issued in contemporary limp calf.

record.title: James Weldon Johnson letter, to Charles H. Wesley, 1937 August 11 : manuscript.
record.note: Place of production from stationery: Five Acres, Seekonk Road, Great Barrington, Mass.

record.title: John H. Pleasonton letter to his father, 1823 June 13.
Citizen Kane : pre-production script, a Mercury Production : typescript / direction-production Orson Welles ; screenplay Herman J. Mankiewicz [and] Orson Welles.
record.note: Typescript draft has original wrappers with split pins. Includes two leaves numbered 69. Autograph note, signed by Harriett Roeg, in pencil on title page: "From the library of Nicolas Roeg."
Accompanying letter is on Beverly Wilshire Hotel stationery.

record.title: Emily Griffin commonplace book : manuscript.
record.note: Pages numbered in ink, the first leaf presumably intended as a title but never completed. Sketches in pen and ink, watercolor and pencil. Paper watermarked 1823. Bound in original dark brown panelled morocco decorated in gilt and blind, spine in compartments, one lettered in gilt ‘Album’, gilt edges.

record.title: Diary and commonplace book : manuscript.
880-02 Berāt of Abdülhamid II : manuscript.
record.note: Sultanic tughra and el-Ġāzi (الغازي) written in gold. Rubrication.

record.title: Houghton family leases and library catalogue : manuscript.
record.note: Internal evidence suggests a mid-18th century date for cataloging the library. The watermark (Pro Patria, with countermark GR) suggests that the laid paper dates from around 1750. The latest publication date of the volumes listed is Whiston’s Josephus (London 1737). Perhaps the library left by John Houghton and inherited by his son John.

record.title: Debt acknowledgement of Robert Borthwick of Vergennes to John Love of Shoreham for $200.00 : manuscript.
record.note: Signed: Royall Tyler, Chief Judge of the Sup. Court writ dated January 26 1810.
On verso: Writ of error, thereof Benajah Place et al. vs. John Love, Addison, Jan. 4 1810, no. 1 under new act.

record.title: John Eliot financial accounts and letterbooks : manuscript.
record.note: First volume: Contents page and approximately 140 text pages (numbered to page 96), followed by 16 blank leaves. Bound in green vellum, initialled "J E III" in manuscript to front board. Written in the same neat, clear copper-plate hand, on paper with watermark: Fleur-de-lis above GR; countermark: C Taylor.

Second volume: Letterbook of approximately 170 text pages, and approximately 60 pages of accounts (together 230 pages, excluding a few blanks). Some pages excised at each end. Bound in green vellum, one clasp intact. Ruled in red for accounts. Probably a stationer's book. Text and accounts written in the same neat, clear italic hand, on paper with watermark: Pro Patria above GR. Manuscript inscription laid on back pastedown: "Gulielma Briggins her book March 1734".

record.title: Letter from Henry Rivington Hill to his sister describing George IV's Coronation, 1821 July 26 : manuscript.
record.note: With a detailed hand-drawn map of the procession route, along with the original envelope addressed to "Miss Hannah Maria Hill" and annotated "Containing what I saw of the procession at the Coronation of George the 4th in 1821." Also with a small piece of black fabric claimed to be from the Coronation robe.

record.title: Diplomas and certificates granted to Giovanni Maria : manuscript.
record.note: First page is decorated with a coat of arms. Next to the coat of arms are a skeleton and a skinless individual. Cherub carrying banner with "In Dei nomine. Amen" on pages three and eleven.

record.title: Buch von den probierten Künsten : manuscript.
record.note: Includes an illustration depicting Helm's concept of a rocket cat, i.e. the use of incendiary devices strapped to animals to penetrate fortifications.

The first leaf begins: "Ain Buech durch ainen Kriegesverstenndgen auss viele probierten Kinsten zusammengezogen, wie ein Zeughauss samptaller Monitur soll gehalten werden. Von Salbetter, Schwefell, Kolen, Pulver, Prechzeug, Fewrpfeil, Mordtfeur, Vergifft, Reuch oder Dempf Wie man sich derselben erweren soll. Auch ainen Bericht der Wagenburg, wie man diselbigen schlagen soll." Dated MDLXX.

record.title: Scrapbook with caricatures and other prints, manuscripts, cuttings, drawings, silhouettes, poems]
record.note: With some French and Italian prints including prints from the series: Caricatures parisiennes, Métamorphoses du jour. Scenes of London.
Interest in France and Italy; the Americas; India and the Middle East.
Album is inscribed by "HH", probably Hubert Hutchings, who references his mother Elizabeth Clark Savery Hutchings (1777-1845).

record.title: Francis A. Harris letter to Benjamin Coates, 1845 January 25 : manuscript.
record.note: Letter written on a 25 x 40 cm sheet of paper folded in half to create pages measuring 25 x 20 cm, then further folded, addressed, and sealed with red wax.

record.title: Samuel Huntington letter, to Heman Swift, 1787 May 17 : manuscript.
record.note: Sections of page detached at folds; some vermin damage; blue paper fragment affixed to bottom of verso.

record.title: Herbert Feis memoir : typescript.
record.note: Donor inherited this copy of the memoir in 2000. Date span of authorship estimated from information in text.

record.title: Thomas Tipton accounts and memoranda book : manuscript.
record.note: Bound in contemporary reverse calf, with a stamp "T. Tipton" on front pastedown.

On recto of front flyleaf: West of England Fire Insurance Company. John Gildon [probably John Gliddon who was secretary from 1807-1810]. West of England Fire Insurance Company was established in 1806 and changed its name to West of England Fire and Life Insurance Company in August of 1808.

record.title: Notebook of poems : manuscript.
record.note: Date estimated from pencilled note on front free endpaper.

record.title: Student notes on and drawings of human anatomy : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: sheets of paper are housed in a contemporary brown marbled paper binding over pasteboard, though unbound. Binding's spine has broken apart; hence, binding now consists of separated front and back cover.

Anatomical drawings: of a skull in profile, of a skull in 3/4 view (manuscript note: non omnis moriar, Στεφανος τους [sic] αθανατοις), of the clavicle and its articulations, of the larynx (3 different perspectives), of the lungs and heart (also includes a sketch of the same drawing; heart itself lifts up to reveal the vascular system), of the male reproductive system (covered by different layers of drawn feathers; includes a copious amount of moveable flaps), of the brain (also with moveable flaps), of the muscles of the ear, and of a man's head. The last drawing is particularly intricate: the top flap shows the man's skin; the three following flaps show muscles; the next shows the skull with an additional flap for the eye; then a flap for the brain matter; final few flaps show a variety of muscles and the larynx. Drawings measure from about 20 x 20 cm to 46.5 cm x 33 cm. They are housed in a large white paper sheet, separately from the notes.

Printed certificate is unsigned, undated, and otherwise unidentified: Theatre London Hospital, Mr. ... has diligently attended ... course of Anatomical Demonstrations and Dissection delivered during the Session ... Certificate was meant to be filled out with manuscript material, but was left unfilled.
Also includes engraved hand-coloured print of an eye: A Diagram of the Human Eye. Published as the Act directs; 1803, J. Murray, Fleet Street.
Sheets with student notes generally consist of multiple sheets of folio paper glued together (up to 9 sheets) and are folded. Longest sheet measures about 195 cm.

record.title: À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs : galley proof, with autograph corrections and additions.
record.note: The text corresponds to pages 28-42 of the 1919 French edition of À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs published by Gallimard, in which the narrator discusses his family's relations with Mr. de Norpois and watches the actress Berma in Racine's rendition of Phaedra.

record.title: Naval log book describing voyages and engagements in Central America and China : manuscript.
record.note: Naval log book of thirty-seven leaves, including 72 pages of manuscript entries in ink on pale blue ruled paper, divided into four sections separately paginated: [4],1-17, [3], 1-21, 1-29 pages
Contemporary quarter sheep and marbled boards, binding rubbed and worn, spine mostly perished in later custom case.
Title in manuscript on front free endpaper: Log of a cruise in the U.S. Sloop of War Cyane 1851, 1852, 1853, 1854; at top of page in a different hand: Kept by Daniel C. Brayton, sailmaker.

record.title: Pali-language fragments.
record.note: Binding: no binding; covered in paper wrapper.
Place of creation either Siam (Thailand) or Cambodia due to use of specific, local letter forms. Identified by Trent Walker (personal correspondence).

record.title: Medical manuscript fragment.
record.note: Decoration: one large miniature showing a doctor letting a lady's blood in front of a sky and grass background. Rubrication. Large two-line initials in red and blue ink.
Folds in parchment likely indicate fragment's use as binding waste.

record.title: Richard Worsam Meade diary and copy book on his first trip to England and Europe : including details of the extralegal seizure of American vessels by the British Navy : manuscript.
record.note: In duodecimo leatherbound journal, leather covers worn and flaked.
Manuscript accomplished in a mixture of ink and pencil.

30 pages with text, consisting of 20 pages of journal entries, with additional sheet laid in of shorter diary entries, and 10 pages related to accounts, dated December, 1794, through March, 1795, with rest of leaves blank.
Journal entries record Meade’s arrival in England in June, 1795, and portions of his travels through France in August of the same year; journal portion approximately 2100 words.

record.title: Seven fragments from the Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra.
Collection of treatises, translations, and correspondence : manuscript.
Aziel Barnes poetry : composed between 1815 and 1843 : manuscript.
record.note: Several passages underlined in red in an unidentified hand.
